description.value:
Devoted servants, desperate heroes, and fools tricked into pacts. Warlocks draw magical power from their connection to supernatural entities. They have a versatile set of gifts from their patrons but have fewer spells than other spellcasters.

The following is a revision of the 5e warlock class, meant to give them a more typical form of spellcasting so they don't require short rests. This version also seeks to make each available pact boon powerful and versatile. Existing 5e subclasses will all work mechanically with this form of the warlock class. Click @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.VLxJ80DY7q7hkXU7.JournalEntryPage.QjLATbZ1uI3tAwjs#warlock]{here} for a summary of changes.

Level 1 Warlocks

When you create a level 1 Warlock, you will need to manually add your ability scores. You will gain the rest of the following automatically:

Recommended Ability Scores

You can take one of these recommended ability score arrays, or you can roll or assign them yourself. You can switch any two ability scores, but you do not add any further bonuses (they're already included).

&reference[Strength]: 8 &reference[Dexterity]:14 &reference[Constitution]: 14 &reference[Intelligence]: 12 &reference[Wisdom]: 12 &reference[Charisma]: 16

or

Strength: 8 Dexterity:15 Constitution: 14 Intelligence: 10 Wisdom: 10 Charisma: 17

Feat

You gain a level 1 @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.lGAvinVvDjAXzQ1Q]{feat} of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

Hit Points

Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + Constitution Modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per warlock level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
Saving Throws: &Reference[Wisdom], &Reference[Charisma]
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.rv19GFzEa0nMTuAF]{Skills}: Choose two skills from &Reference[Arcana], &Reference[Deception], &Reference[History], &Reference[Intimidation], &Reference[Investigation], &Reference[Nature], and &Reference[Religion]

Items

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.wPcrbw6GTNb9ZYvp]{light crossbow} and 20 bolts -OR- any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
  • @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Item.jSi9ralAm7FzUQbH]{Padded Armor}
  • any @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}
  • two @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-equipment.Y6IT6GdS7C81Yz02]{daggers}
  • a component pouch -OR- an arcane focus
  • a scholar's pack -OR- a dungeoneer's pack

Multiclass Characters

Instead of leveling up in your original class, you can take a warlock level when you level up. When you do, you gain only a portion of what first level warlocks gain.

Multiclassing Ability Score Requirements

Taking levels in several classes requires exceptional ability. You must meet the multiclassing ability score requirements for both your original class and the class you are multiclassing into.

For warlocks you must have:

  • Charisma: 14

Hit Points

Per Level: 1d8 (or 5) + Constitution Modifier
Hit Dice: 1d8 per warlock level

Proficiencies

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1]{Armor}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.q10XUuFrVlw8qYj1.JournalEntryPage.4ZoOlPhNDk46Vvnr]{Light Armor}
@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp]{Weapons}: @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.nfEDSQG0DMBs7eGp.JournalEntryPage.0OO6dvVBUM4XAluS]{Simple Weapon}

Warlock Advancement

advancement.title: Items
advancement.hint: Choose a light crossbow -OR- any simple weapon

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 3rd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 4th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 5th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.
This list only shows 7th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 8th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 9th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Superior Ability
advancement.hint: You increase one ability score of your choice by 2, to a maximum of 22.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 6th level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint:
At this level and every level you gain an ability score improvement, you also gain a feat of your choice. You are eligible for general feats and warlock feats by default.
        You may be eligible for other feats, which you can drag from the appropriate compendium into this box below.
        
        Some feats have additional prerequisites. Check the description of a feat before choosing it.

advancement.title: Eldritch Invocations
advancement.hint:
In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability. This link will take you to a list.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               When you gain a warlock level, you can choose one of the invocations you know and replace it with another invocation that you meet the requirements for. If you replace an invocation, you lose all benefits from that invocation. You cannot replace an invocation that is the prerequisite for another invocation or feat you possess.

advancement.title: Spells Known
advancement.hint: This list only shows 2nd level spells. If you want to pick a lower level spell, you can drag-drop the spell from the Elkan 5e Spells compendium.

advancement.title: Pact Boon
advancement.hint: You use your Warlock Patron's power to gain one of the following features of your choice; choose one of the Pact of the Chain, Pact of the Tome, or Pact of the Warrior. Each pact has Eldritch Invocations that build on its powers, so pick the pact that fits your warlock's archetype most to get the most out of later invocations.

advancement.title: Feat
advancement.hint: You gain a level 1 feat of your choice. You can choose from the feats available to all classes or choose a level 1 class-specific feat, if there is one available.​

advancement.title: Warlock Patron
advancement.hint:
You form a pact with a powerful magical creature, who grants you your power. This creature usually has no direct control over you, but you likely performed a task or promised something to the creature in exchange. Some patrons are malicious, like demons who are interested in taking your soul. Some are benevolent, like powerful fey who want to protect the world. Your choice of patron represents where your warlock got their power.
    
    Your patron gives you new features at levels 3, 6, 10, and 14. 
    
    Warlock patrons available elsewhere are compatible with this version of the warlock class. We have given warlocks their patron's expanded spell list as extra prepared spells that don't count against the number of warlock spells known, and so you should grant warlocks using non-Elkan subclasses their expanded spell list for free as well.

 For help converting a subclass to function with Elkan 5e, see the Elkan 5e Rules Compendium -> Help.
